TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program questions from a newbie

Articles.Content:
Hi all,i am new to the forum i just have a few quick questions,i was just wondering if this is a single player game,also i was just wondering what is the objective of the game,and if there are many missions in singleplayer.one last question is Kerbal Space Program only avalible to buy on the the devs website,also do i use my registration from the forum for my login at the main page,thanks in advance all:confused:

Edited October 4, 2012 by shea1980

Hiya shea1980, welcome to the community

KSP is still in development right now, and missions are not yet implemented though they will be eventually, the idea is to run a whole space program from humble beginnings

Currently KSP is a sandbox game, but many players post challenges in this board for others to try, and though KSP is single player, people 'play' against each other by comparing challenge results, also there are some persistent world add-ons that allow players to share their saved files.

Also, KSP is only purchasable from the store at this time, but will be on Steam eventually as well, Steam do not accept alpha games though.

You only pay once, then you get the current alpha and every update after that for free, the price will gradually rise as development continues so it's best to get it now rather than wait

At it's alpha stage there isn't "singleplayer". It is currently only a sandbox game with no objective. But fear not, they will soon add objectives and singleplayer missions. And you will still be able to choose sandbox mode. Multiplayer is not being planned at the moment, it may never be in the game. It might it, might not, though saying "multiplayer" is something you don't want to do. There are lots of things to do and vast places to explore with mods to help you along the way. (Use a separate account for buying I believe) If you have any questions ask them in the appropriate forum and I hope you become a fellow Kerbonaut just like the rest of us.
Thats fantastic thanks m8 for you quick responce

KSP is currently in alpha.. Meaning it's FAR from finished. Right now, there are no objectives. It's a giant sandbox where you do what you want. In the future there will be a campaign with missions, etc, but right now, they're still adding basic infrastructure and content.

As far as the store/forum login, i'm not sure. Since I don't remember making a forum account, I THINK they're linked, but.. Best thing to do, is just try to log in.. It will either let you, or you'll have to make a store account.. not really a big deal either way.
KSP is currently in awesome stage, where there are no rules, hundreds of cool mods, no objective, no enemies, no money, and plenty of bugs.

Your store login and your forum login do not have to be the same, they can be if you want though, you can use the same email and password for both if you like.

If you buy KSP you'll be prompted to provide an email for the confirmation email to be sent to, and be asked to input a password, the confirmation email can often end up in the spam box so don't forget to check it

Also, KSP is only purchasable from the store at this time, but will be on Steam eventually as well, Steam do not accept alpha games though.

Well, it'll be put on steam as part of a general release to all digital distribution sites (and physical shops if it gets popular enough). I don't think squad are the sort of development studio to make users use such an obtrusive program as steam whether or not they want it as they've said they're not keen on DRM.
